data.title: Genetic Control of Programmed Cell Death in the Nematode Caenorhabditis Elegans
data.meta_description: Naturally-occurring or “programmed” cell death appears to be a universal aspect of animal development (e.g., Ref. 1). For example, massive cell death occurs during the development of the mammalian fetus, particularly in the fetal brain; in areas of the...
